revised_title: The Role of the Royal Society in Selecting and Publishing Scientific Papers
tldr: The Royal Society has established a committee to review and select papers for publication in the Philosophical Transactions. The committee chooses papers based on their importance, singularity, or advantageous treatment, without guaranteeing the certainty of facts or the propriety of reasoning. This process ensures the quality and credibility of the published papers.
